org.openadaptor.core
Interface IWriteConnector

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractWriteConnector, HttpWriteConnector, JMSWriteConnector, RMIWriteConnector
public interface IWriteConnector

Represents a class that can send / write some data to an external resource.

Author:
perryj

Method Summary
 void connect()
          This should be called before deliver(Object[]) is called.
 java.lang.Object deliver(java.lang.Object[] data)
          Delivers some data to the external resource to which the implementation is connected.
 void disconnect()
          This should be called before the implementation is unreferenced.
 void validate(java.util.List exceptions)
          This method checks that the current state of an implementation is "meaningful".
 

Method Detail

validate

public void validate(java.util.List exceptions)
This method checks that the current state of an implementation is "meaningful". Implementations of IWriteConnector are typically beans with zero-arg constructors. Implementations are encouraged to add exception to the list parameter rather than throwing them. This allows the calling code to collate the exceptions. If the implementation is an IComponent then the exceptions should be a ValidationException.

Parameters:
exceptions - collection to which exceptions should be added

connect

public void connect()
This should be called before deliver(Object[]) is called. Implementations should use this method to establish connections to external resources and prepare to accept calls to deliver(Object[]). Exceptions should be thrown as RuntimeExceptions. If the implementation is an IComponent then it should throw ConnectionException.

disconnect

public void disconnect()
This should be called before the implementation is unreferenced. Implementations should use this method to "cleanup" connections to external resources and reset state. Exceptions should be thrown as RuntimeExceptions. If the implementation is an IComponent then it should throw ConnectionException.

deliver

public java.lang.Object deliver(java.lang.Object[] data)
Delivers some data to the external resource to which the implementation is connected. It is assumed that the implementation will cast the data to the expected type(s). Exceptions should be thrown as RuntimeExceptions. Implementations that are IComponents should throw ConnectionExceptions.

Parameters:
data - the data to process
Returns:
the response from the external resource
